result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Carter Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew Carter Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared by video for Andrew Carter Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Doctor's Excuse Letter.

Defendant Andrew Carter Jr in court.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status of counsel.  Notice of appearance filed by Attorney Ritter was filed in error.  Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Allison Ritter who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $50.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew Carter in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew Carter appeared by video means.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Matter is set for status in Br. 40 September 6, 2022 at 8:30am. The preliminary hearing date should have been vacated. Matter is adjourned to Br. 40.

Defendant Andrew Carter in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an indigency hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court ordered defendant to reach out to 5 private defense attorney's to see if they will take the defendant's case. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant previously posted $5,000 cash. Court orders $1,000 remain on deposit and the rest be returned to the remitter. 
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Andrew Carter in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Defense counsel requests an indigency hearing.  Case is adjourned for indigency hearing in Br 40 and preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/09/2022@1pm
